text:
Computer: MSI KT7 Pro2-A motherboard, Athelon 900 MHz processor, 64 MB of RAM, 
30GB ATA100 HD, Matrox G450 32MB AGP.
Software: Windows 2000 Pro SP1 with ATA100 Fix, Java 1.302 Standard Edition. 
All lastest motherboard and video card drivers are installed.

Problem: I'm not sure if this is Tomcat problem, but it is very reproducable on 
my computer. When I start the Tomcat server with no additonal web apps 
installed, and then minimize it to the task bar and then run the shutdown 
script, my computer goes to a blue screen very quickly and then it re-boots. 
I'm not able to read anything on the blue screen, so I don't know when causes 
the crash. Any suggestions on getting more information from my computer before 
the crash occures?

creator: cmanolache@yahoo.com
text:
Tomcat ( or any java program ) shouldn't be able to crash the server. 
If it does - you have a big problem, and no fix in tomcat can help ( as it 
may happen with other programs ). It's also impossible to reproduce or fix.
You can try a different VM, or on a different computer.

Costin Manolache wrote: "It's also impossible to reproduce or fix."

I don't understand this comment. It is very reproducable on my computer! It is 
also very fixable, though the fix may not, and is proably not in Tomcat or 
java. But that is not for certian.
